channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Various sizes of potholes on Gloucester Old Rd near new build development, 11th January
item.description:
Various sized potholes on both sides of carriageway, the potholes have been here since early last year and are getting bigger and deeper. I use this road everyday to my commute to work and I’m concerned that they will eventually damage mine and others cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Old Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheel killer, 11th January
item.description:
Nasty pothole. Caused damage to car severe enough to now be unsafe to drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 257 Hatherley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pot hole on the roundabout, 11th January
item.description:
The pothole is on the roundabout , I didn’t see it yesterday Tuesday 10th jan , and avoided it Wednesday 11th as I know it was there. It’s very deep and directly on the roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Buccaneer Avenue, Brockworth

item.title: Traffic lights change to red too quickly, 11th January
item.description:
These traffic lights change from green to red in 2 seconds, which is too quickly if travelling at 60mph speed limit requiring hard braking, the light change needs slowing down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several deep and dangerous pot holes on Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve, Gl528PB., 11th January
item.description:
Several deep and dangerous pot holes outside no. 2 to approx no. 10 Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve, Gl528PB. They have been there for months. They have been filled in with gravel at some point and the gravel is all over the road flicking up and hitting vehicles as they go by. It’s a highly used road with many buses and trade vans.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Two Hedges Road, Woodmancote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded road outside primary school, 11th January
item.description:
Please clean these drains before my son and I get soaked again. They need cleaning out much more often than happens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Boleyn Cottages Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous pothole. Tyre wrecked. Stuck waiting to be rescued., 10th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Flight Farm Leckhampton Hill, Leckhampton Hill

item.title: Very loose paving slab with no support or surround, 10th January
item.description:
This is one of a number of paving slabs that have been damaged on the pedestrianised section of the Promenade in Cheltenham, close to House of Fraser. Others have been repaired quickly and efficiently but this one is very loose and is a potential trip hazard. It is close to the Kuoni Travel Store

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit 3, 37 Promenade, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Redundant Road Works Signs been at Location for approx. 3 Months, 10th January
item.description:
The location is approx 10 yards into the Cleeve Common Road from the Burnt Oak Crossroads. The signs are approx 10 yards apart discarded on to the verge. They have been there about 3 months and subsequent road works in thet area have clearly ignored them and not collected them up. They have benn hit and driven over by vehicles and are clearly a road hazard. Please can they be collected up as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Sevenhampton
Report on FixMyStreet
